SEARCH
Package it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.SceneControllers

Class GameController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.view.GUI.SceneControllers.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
Initializable
public class GameController extends Object implements Initializable
GameController class manages the GUI for the game. It handles various aspects of the game interface, including: - Displaying the game board and player boards. - Managing player resources and updating resource counts. - Handling user interactions through buttons and drag-and-drop functionalities. - Controlling game state updates and threading for real-time updates. - Implementing multiple tabs for different game functionalities (e.g., drawing cards, scoring). - Supporting zoom and scroll functionalities for the game board. - Displaying chat messages and indicating new messages with a visual cue. - Managing opponent data display and setup. - Implementing game-specific UI elements such as buttons for flipping cards and centering the board.

This controller class uses JavaFX for UI components and threading mechanisms for real-time updates. It interacts with a ClientInterface for game data and manages data updates through SharedUpdate and other helper classes.

The game-specific logic for placing cards, updating game state, and handling turns is embedded in this class.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface Initializable

    • setOpponentData

      public void setOpponentData(String usernameOpponent)
      Sets up opponent data display on the board. Displays opponent's board and initializes UI components for opponent-specific data.
      Parameters:
      usernameOpponent - The username of the opponent whose data needs to be displayed.

    • setHand

      protected void setHand(String username, boolean frontSide)
      Sets up the display of cards in the hand container based on the player's or opponent's hand. If the username matches the client's username, displays the client's hand with card images. If the username does not match, displays the opponent's hand with generic card backs.
      Parameters:
      username - The username of the player whose hand is to be displayed.
      frontSide - Boolean flag indicating whether to display card fronts (true) or backs (false). Fronts are displayed for the client's hand, backs for opponents.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - If there is an error in fetching data from the server during initialization.

    • setClient

      public void setClient(ClientInterface client)
      Sets the client interface and initializes player data based on the client's data.
      Parameters:
      client - The client interface to set.

    • updateView

      protected void updateView()
      Updates the view of the active tab, if not currently on the Objectives tab. Calls the update method of the corresponding tab controller to refresh its content.

    • setTurn

      protected void setTurn()
      Sets the turn message to indicate the player's turn to place a card.

    • setStandby

      protected void setStandby()
      Sets the turn message to indicate that the player is entering standby.

    • centerBoard

      protected void centerBoard()
      Centers the board view within the scroll pane by adjusting horizontal and vertical scroll values. Removes the center board button if it exists.

    • setActiveTab

      protected void setActiveTab(String activeTab)
      Sets the active tab based on the provided tab name.
      Parameters:
      activeTab - The name of the tab to set as active.
